item.title: [PI] Help please (login screen) [PI]
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“jummppy, post:6, topic:542158”]Are you talking about making his method static Pure_[/quote]That will not work.

Upon re-reading op, try changing aBackground_966 to aBackground_967. Then make sure the method you want in Background exists.

item.title: [PI] Help please (login screen) [PI]
item.dc:creator: @cunniff55 cunniff55
item.description:
@cunniff55 wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:4, topic:542158”]In your background class. On topic though, The aBackground_967 object you’re trying to access isn’t accessible in the given scope.
Perhaps create another or properly reference it/change its access modifier.[/quote]

im new to coding and i dont really understand what u said, would you be able to show me how to do it?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help please (login screen) [PI]
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

In your background class. On topic though, The aBackground_967 object you’re trying to access isn’t accessible in the given scope.
Perhaps create another or properly reference it/change its access modifier.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help please (login screen) [PI]
item.dc:creator: @cunniff55 cunniff55
item.description:
@cunniff55 wrote:

I have just recently added a custom login screen, as i went to compile it i got these two errors. Can someone help me fix?

Error:
[spoiler][/spoiler]

CODE:
[spoiler]private void drawLoginScreen(boolean flag)
{
resetImageProducers();
aRSImageProducer_1109.initDrawingArea();
aBackground_966.method346(0, 0);
char c = ‘\u0168’;
char c1 = ‘\310’;
if(loginScreenState == 0)
{
int j = c1 / 2 - 65;
if(loginMessage1.length() > 0)
{
chatTextDrawingArea.method382(0xffffff, c / 2, loginMessage1, j - 0, true);
chatTextDrawingArea.method382(0xffffff, c / 2, loginMessage2, j - 15, true);
j += 54;
} else
{
chatTextDrawingArea.method382(0xffffff, c / 2, loginMessage2, j - 7, true);
j += 54;
}
chatTextDrawingArea.method389(true, c / 2 - 103, 0xffffff, “” + myUsername + ((loginScreenCursorPos == 0) & (loopCycle % 40 < 20) ? “@yel@|” : “”), j);
j += 50;
chatTextDrawingArea.method389(true, c / 2 - 103, 0xffffff, “” + TextClass.passwordAsterisks(myPassword) + ((loginScreenCursorPos == 1) & (loopCycle % 40 < 20) ? “@yel@|” : “”), j);
j += 70;
if(!flag)
{
int i1 = c / 2 - 0;
int l1 = c1 / 2 + 50;
//aBackground_967.method346(i1 - 73, l1 - 20);
//chatTextDrawingArea.method382(0xffffff, i1, “Login”, l1 + 5, true);
i1 = c / 2 + 0;
//aBackground_967.method346(i1 - 73, l1 - 20);
//chatTextDrawingArea.method382(0xffffff, i1, “Cancel”, l1 + 5, true);
}
}
if(loginScreenState == 3)
{
chatTextDrawingArea.method382(0xffffff, c / 2, “@whi@How to play Project-Turmoil:”, c1 / 2 - 75, true);
int k = c1 / 2 - 45;
chatTextDrawingArea.method382(0xffffff, c / 2, “If you need any help playing Project-Turmoil”, k, true);
k += 15;
chatTextDrawingArea.method382(0xffffff, c / 2, “then click the ‘Knowledge Base’ button on the”, k, true);
k += 15;
chatTextDrawingArea.method382(0xffffff, c / 2, "top of the client and review the guides/tutorials ", k, true);
k += 15;
chatTextDrawingArea.method382(0xffffff, c / 2, “on how to play. If that doesn’t help then please”, k, true);
k += 15;
chatTextDrawingArea.method382(0xffffff, c / 2, “create a new thread on the forums for help.”, k, true);
k += 15;
int j1 = c / 2;
int i2 = c1 / 2 + 50;
aBackground_967.method346(j1 - 73, i2 - 20);
chatTextDrawingArea.method382(0xffffff, j1, “Go Back”, i2 + 5, true);
}
aRSImageProducer_1109.drawGraphics(116, super.graphics, 185);
if(welcomeScreenRaised)
{
welcomeScreenRaised = false;
aRSImageProducer_1107.drawGraphics(0, super.graphics, 128);
aRSImageProducer_1108.drawGraphics(371, super.graphics, 202);
aRSImageProducer_1112.drawGraphics(265, super.graphics, 0);
aRSImageProducer_1113.drawGraphics(265, super.graphics, 562);
aRSImageProducer_1114.drawGraphics(171, super.graphics, 128);
aRSImageProducer_1115.drawGraphics(171, super.graphics, 562);
}
}[/spoiler]
